item.title: Switzerland Suspends MFN Status To India: What It Means For Stock Market Investors? - News18
item.description:
Switzerland Suspends MFN Status To India: What It Means For Stock Market Investors?

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: News18

Switzerland's recent suspension of the Most Favoured Nation (MFN) status for India poses challenges for Indian companies, particularly in finance, pharmaceuticals, and IT sectors, affecting trade dynamics between the two nations.

  • The MFN suspension disrupts the preferential trade framework under WTO rules for Indian firms.
  • Indian companies will now incur a 10% tax on dividends and incomes in Switzerland, up from 5%, effective January 1, 2025.
  • The change may lead to higher tariffs and reduced market access for Indian goods in Switzerland.
  • The Indian government anticipates renegotiating its double taxation treaty with Switzerland due to changes in trade agreements.
  • In FY 2023-24, bilateral trade reached approximately $23.76 billion, with a significant portion being imports from Switzerland.
“Investors need to keep an eye on sectors like pharmaceuticals, IT, financial services, and engineering goods.” - Stock Market Analyst

The suspension of MFN status necessitates adaptability among Indian investors and firms, as they navigate new tax implications and trade barriers in the Swiss market.

item.title: Contempt Power Is Not Only For Violation Of Express Orders; Applies To Any Act Intended To Frustrate... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Contempt Power Is Not Only For Violation Of Express Orders; Applies To Any Act Intended To Frustrate

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: LiveLaw

In a significant judgment, the Supreme Court established that contempt jurisdiction extends beyond explicit violations of court orders to any actions intended to frustrate court proceedings or bypass eventual judgments.

  • The Supreme Court ruled that contempt includes conduct aiming to disrupt judicial authority or processes.
  • A borrower transferring property during ongoing court proceedings was found to be in contempt of court.
  • The contempt case was prompted by a petition from Celir LLP, the auction purchaser of the property.
  • The Court noted attempts by the borrower and transferee to obstruct the implementation of its judgment.
  • Despite ruling that such attempts constitute contempt, the Court did not hold the parties guilty but allowed them a chance to comply with the judgment.
"The contempt jurisdiction of the court extends beyond the mere direct disobedience of explicit orders. Deliberate conduct aimed at frustrating court proceedings may amount to contempt."

The ruling emphasizes the need to respect the judicial process, indicating the Court's readiness to intervene against actions that threaten its authority and the rule of law.

item.title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi 'yuva' gaffe in Lok Sabha leaves NDA MPs in splits - The Times of India
item.description:
```html

Watch: Rahul Gandhi 'yuva' gaffe in Lok Sabha leaves NDA MPs in splits

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Times of India

Image:

In a recent session of the Lok Sabha, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's slip of the tongue referring to himself as 'yuva' (youth) caused laughter among NDA MPs, highlighting the lighter moments amidst serious political discussions.

  • Rahul Gandhi made a humorous gaffe while addressing the Lok Sabha.
  • The incident drew laughter and reactions from members of the NDA.
  • Gandhi's remarks commented on youth engagement in politics.
“The truth is it is the current NDA government that had made a ministry for fisheries in 2019,” PM Modi remarked during the session.

The lighthearted moment serves as a reminder of the human side of politics, where leaders can share a laugh despite differences.

```

item.title: S.197 CrPC| Sanction Not Needed To Prosecute Police Officers Accused Of Lodging False Cases Or... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Ruling on Police Officials and False Cases

Publication Date: December 13, 2024

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court ruled that police officials accused of lodging false cases are not protected from prosecution under Section 197 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, as such actions do not fall within their official duties.

  • The Court clarified that the protection of Section 197 CrPC applies only to acts performed in the course of official duties.
  • Fabrication of evidence and filing of bogus cases are considered outside the scope of official duties.
  • The ruling overturned the MP High Court's decision which had quashed the criminal case against the accused police officials for lack of sanction under Section 197.
  • The Court emphasized the necessity of evaluating the facts and circumstances of each case before deciding on the application of Section 197 CrPC.
  • It ruled that allowing public officials to misuse their status under the guise of official duty would lead to illegal and unethical acts.
  • The trial against the police officials was directed to proceed, affirming that wrongful acts emerging from official duties are not automatically protected.
“Allowing so would enable the accused to use their status as public servants as a facade for doing an objectionable, illegal and unlawful act and take undue advantage of their position." - Supreme Court

In conclusion, this ruling underscores the judicial commitment to accountability among public officials, ensuring that misuse of power cannot be shielded by the protections typically afforded under Section 197 CrPC.

item.title: India Political Updates | 'Indian farmers being treated like it's Pak border', says Bajrang Punia on use of tear gas, water cannon - Deccan Herald
item.description:
India Political Updates | 17-18 people injured in police action at Sambhu border, says farmer leader Sarwan Singh

Publication Date: 14 December 2024

Source: ANI

A delegation of BJP leaders has accused the Aam Aadmi Party of manipulating votes, while farmers are in the midst of a 'Dilli Chalo' march facing police resistance at the Sambhu border, leading to injuries among protesters.

  • 17-18 people injured due to police action during farmer protests at Sambhu border, according to farmer leader Sarwan Singh.
  • Heavy police presence deployed to disperse the 'Dilli Chalo' march initiative by farmers.
  • Police used tear gas and water cannons against protesting farmers.
  • BJP discusses evidence of alleged fake votes ahead of upcoming Delhi Assembly polls.

"Both the forums have decided to withdraw the 'jatha' today. We are hearing that 17-18 people have been injured. We will hold a PC after some time and inform about the further action." - Sarwan Singh Pandher

The ongoing protests highlight significant tensions between farmer groups and law enforcement, reflecting broader political strains as elections approach. Observers are keenly watching how these events unfold.

item.title: BPSC 70th Prelims Exam 2024 Live Updates: Exam analysis, paper leak allegations - The Indian Express
item.description:
BPSC 70th CCE Prelims Exam 2024 Live Updates: Exam analysis, paper leak allegations

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

In the BPSC 70th preliminary exam, conducted across 912 centers, negative marking will be implemented for incorrect answers. Only successful candidates will proceed to the main exam.

  • The exam took place in a single shift from 12 noon to 2 pm.
  • Over 4.83 lakh aspirants registered for the exam.
  • 2,035 vacancies will be filled as part of this recruitment process.
  • No normalization of marks will be conducted as the exam is in 'one shift, one paper' format.
  • The dates for the BPSC CCE 70th main exam will be announced after the prelims results.
“Negative markings will be applied for incorrect answers. Only those who pass the preliminary exam will be eligible to take the BPSC CCE main exam.”

In conclusion, the BPSC 70th preliminary exam is a significant step for over 4.83 lakh aspirants, setting the stage for future recruitment opportunities in the state.

item.title: 'Harassment by ED, BJP leaders': Purported suicide note of MP businessman, wife sparks political slugfest - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Harassment by ED, BJP leaders: Purported suicide note of MP businessman, wife sparks political slugfest

Published on: 14 December 2024, 07:50 IST

Source: PTI

A purported suicide note linked to the deaths of a businessman and his wife in Madhya Pradesh has ignited political tensions between the Congress party and the ruling BJP, with allegations of harassment by the Enforcement Directorate (ED).

  • The couple, Manoj and Neha Parmar, were found hanging in their home in Sehore district.
  • The suicide note, addressed to key political leaders including Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Rahul Gandhi, accused ED officials and BJP leaders of harassment.
  • The Congress party claims that Parmar's affiliation with them led to the couple's targeting by the ED.
  • State Congress president Jitu Patwari described the death as a potential state-sponsored murder rather than suicide.
  • ED has been investigating Parmar for alleged financial crimes including a money laundering case.
  • Former MP Chief Minister Kamal Nath linked the deaths to political pressure from the BJP government and ED.
"The whole case was more about wiping out an entire family than harassing a businessman to the point of suicide for political reasons." - Kamal Nath

This incident has raised significant concerns regarding the intersection of politics and law enforcement in India, prompting calls for a thorough investigation into the circumstances surrounding the couple's deaths.

item.title: Atul Subhash Suicide | Accused-Wife Moves Allahabad High Court Seeking Anticipatory Bail In Abetment To... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Atul Subhash Suicide | Accused-Wife Moves Allahabad High Court Seeking Anticipatory Bail In Abetment To

Publication Date: December 14, 2024 | Source: Live Law

The wife of Atul Subhash, a 34-year-old techie from Bangalore who allegedly died by suicide, has filed for anticipatory bail in an abetment case against her and her family.

  • Atul Subhash left a 'justice is due' placard and a 24-page suicide note, along with an 81-minute accusatory video against his wife.
  • An FIR was lodged by Atul's brother against Nikita Singhania and three family members, alleging abetment to suicide.
  • Nikita and her family have filed for anticipatory bail, which is set to be heard in the coming week.
  • A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking reforms in domestic violence and dowry laws to protect husbands and their families.
An anticipatory bail petition has been filed by his wife, Nikita Singhania, and three of her family members before the Allahabad High Court in connection with an FIR filed against them over abetment to suicide case.

This case highlights ongoing issues surrounding domestic violence, allegations of harassment, and the complexities of legal battles in family courts.

item.title: Delhi now capital of crime, people worried: Arvind Kejriwal writes to Amit Shah - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi now capital of crime, people worried: Arvind Kejriwal writes to Amit Shah

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Arvind Kejriwal has expressed grave concerns about the escalating crime rates in Delhi, urging a meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah to address the issues related to law and order.

  • Kejriwal's letter highlights Delhi's alarming status as the "crime capital" of India, particularly for crimes against women.
  • Delhi ranks first in murder cases and experiences a rise in extortion and bomb threats.
  • A 350% increase in drug-related crimes has been reported, raising security fears among residents.
  • Kejriwal criticized the BJP's handling of law enforcement in the capital and called for unity among Delhi's citizens.
  • The Delhi High Court has mandated a comprehensive action plan to address bomb threats, setting an eight-week deadline.
"Delhi's law and order is under the Central Government, but Delhi is now being known as the capital of crime." - Arvind Kejriwal
"Amit Shah ji has ruined Delhi. He has turned Delhi into a jungle raj. People are living a life of terror everywhere." - Arvind Kejriwal

The crisis in Delhi’s law and order management has led to growing discontent among residents, prompting calls for urgent governmental action to restore safety and security in the capital.

item.title: 'One Nation, One Election' : How Constitution Is Proposed To Be Amended For Simultaneous Elections To Lok ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
One Nation, One Election: How Constitution Is Proposed To Be Amended For Simultaneous Elections To Lok

Publication Date: Not specified Source: LiveLaw

The 'One Nation, One Election' Bill aims to amend the Constitution to facilitate simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and all Legislative Assemblies. The Bill is set to be tabled in Parliament and proposes significant changes to existing electoral laws.

  • The Bill seeks to insert Article 82A for simultaneous elections to the House of the People and all Legislative Assemblies.
  • It also amends Articles 83, 172, and 327 regarding the duration and conduct of elections.
  • Simultaneous elections mean general elections held together for the Lok Sabha and all Legislative Assemblies.
  • Provisions include how mid-term elections will be managed and their alignment for Union Territories.
"There was an imperative need for holding of simultaneous elections. The imposition of Model Code of Conduct in various parts of the country which are poll-bound puts on hold the entire development programs." - Government Statement

The proposed amendments focus on streamlining the electoral process, addressing inefficiencies caused by staggered elections, and aligning legislative terms to enhance governance and development.

item.title: What Priyanka Gandhi meant when she told BJP: ‘Learn from us on Emergency, you too apologise’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
What Priyanka Gandhi meant when she told BJP: ‘Learn from us on Emergency, you too apologise’

Publication Date: Recent | Source: Indian Express

In her inaugural speech in Parliament, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra addressed the BJP's criticisms regarding the Emergency, urging them to acknowledge their own mistakes and fight fair elections.

  • Priyanka Gandhi spoke during a special debate on the Constitution, challenging BJP leaders.
  • She quoted Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, suggesting that the BJP should apologize for its mistakes.
  • Congress leaders, including Rahil Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi, have previously acknowledged the Emergency as a “mistake.”
  • Historian Pranab Mukherjee described the Emergency as a "misadventure" in his writings.
  • Shashi Tharoor highlighted that the Emergency was "undemocratic" but not "unconstitutional."
“What happened in the Emergency is wrong. Let us not go back and forth on it.” — Jyotiraditya Scindia

The Congress party has a history of reflecting on the Emergency, with leaders admitting its faults while navigating complex discussions around accountability and historical context.

item.title: Though S.52 TP Act Doesn't Make Pendente Lite Transfer Void, Court Can Invalidate Such Sale Exercising... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Though S.52 TP Act Doesn't Make Pendente Lite Transfer Void, Court Can Invalidate Such Sale Exercising Contempt Jurisdiction

Publication Date: September 21, 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court ruled that while a transfer during ongoing court proceedings is not automatically void, it can be invalidated if done in contempt of court orders.

  • The case involved a contempt petition filed by Celir LLP regarding a property auctioned under the SARFAESI Act.
  • The Supreme Court ruled that even if Section 52 of the Transfer of Property Act does not make such transfers void, courts can reverse them to uphold judicial authority.
  • The transaction in question occurred after a Supreme Court petition was filed, highlighting contempt of judicial directions.
  • The Court emphasized the need for respect towards the court's authority and the judicial process.
  • Senior Advocates represented the involved parties in the case.

"The mere conduct of parties aimed at frustrating the court proceedings or circumventing its decisions, even without an explicit prohibitory order, constitutes contempt. Such actions interfere with the administration of justice." - Supreme Court

The court's decision reinforces the importance of adhering to court directions and maintaining the integrity of the judicial system, even in the context of property transfers.

item.title: E.V.K.S. Elangovan, senior Congress leader and Erode (East) MLA, no more - The Hindu
item.description:
E.V.K.S. Elangovan, senior Congress leader and Erode (East) MLA, no more

Publication Date: December 14, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Former chief of the Tamil Nadu Congress Committee (TNCC) and former Union Minister of State, E.V.K.S. Elangovan, passed away in Chennai on Saturday morning after a brief illness at the age of 73.

  • Mr. Elangovan was admitted to MIOT hospital on November 13.
  • He is survived by his wife and a son.
  • He represented Erode (East), a seat previously held by his deceased son, E. Thirumahan Everaa.
  • He was a prominent figure in Tamil Nadu politics, serving as TNCC president twice.
  • He was also a former Union Minister of State, with responsibilities in key sectors such as Petroleum and Commerce.
"He held the post of TNCC president twice - 2000 to 2002 and 2014 to 2016 when the party was increasingly getting marginalised in the State politics."

With a notable political lineage, Mr. Elangovan's contributions to the Congress party and Tamil Nadu politics have left a lasting impact.

item.title: Farmers resume ‘Delhi chalo’ protest march, internet suspended in Ambala - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Farmers resume ‘Delhi chalo’ protest march, internet suspended in Ambala

Publication Date: December 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A group of farmers has resumed their protest march towards Delhi, asserting their right to agitate at the national capital, while internet services are suspended in Ambala to maintain public order.

  • 101 farmers resumed their ‘Delhi Chalo’ protest from Haryana's Shambhu border, marking the 307th day of their agitation.
  • Farmers demand legal guarantees for Minimum Support Price (MSP), debt waivers, pension, withdrawal of police cases, and justice for victims of the 2021 Lakhimpur Kheri violence.
  • Police deployed tear gas and water cannons as farmers continued their march despite warnings.
  • The Haryana government suspended mobile internet services in 12 villages in Ambala until December 17 to prevent unrest.
  • Supreme Court intervened to ensure medical aid for a farmer on a hunger strike, emphasizing the importance of dialogue over agitation.
"The Union Agriculture Minister has not been speaking about the protest either and the way BJP MPs are doing 'bayanbazi' is going to cause division in communities." - Sarwan Singh Pandher, KMM leader

The ongoing protests highlight the farmers' determination to press for their rights amidst heightened tensions and police interventions.

item.title: LK Advani, veteran BJP leader, admitted to Apollo Hospital in Delhi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
LK Advani, veteran BJP leader, admitted to Apollo Hospital in Delhi

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Veteran BJP leader Lal Krishna Advani has been admitted to Apollo Hospital in New Delhi, where he is currently in stable condition and under observation.

  • Advani, aged 96, is being treated by Dr. Vinit Suri, a senior neurology consultant.
  • He was admitted two days ago, and this is not his first hospitalization at this facility this year.
  • The specific reason for his recent admission has not yet been disclosed.
  • Advani is a key figure in the BJP's rise to prominence and has had a long political career since joining the party in 1951.
"Advani is widely recognized for guiding the BJP from a mere two seats in the 1984 general election to becoming a national force in the 1990s."

Advani's contributions and leadership have significantly impacted Indian politics, especially through his role in the Ram Janmabhoomi movement, which strengthened the BJP's political position.

item.title: ‘Our children are brave servants of Allah’, read Delhi schools' bomb threat email - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Our children are brave servants of Allah’, read Delhi schools' bomb threat email

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024

Source: HT News Desk

Day after 30 schools in Delhi received bomb threats, several schools in the city were sent similar threats via email on Saturday, police said.

  • Bomb threat emails were sent to several schools in Delhi, including Delhi Public School, RK Puram, and Ryan International School, Vasant Kunj.
  • The email was sent from childrenofallah@outlook.com and signed under the name of Barry Allah.
  • The email stated that "Our children are brave servants of Allah. They shall complete their task."
  • Police and security teams are currently searching the school premises, with nothing suspicious found yet.
  • Previous bomb threat emails on Monday demanded $30,000 and threatened to detonate small bombs hidden in the buildings.
"Our bomb vests are blessed by the Prophet Muhammad. They shall not fail their goal. Our children are brave servants of Allah. They shall complete their task."

The bomb threat emails have raised concerns among parents and school staff, with police assuring them that thorough investigations are ongoing and safety remains their top priority.

item.title: Delhi school receives bomb threat emails, third incident this week - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi school receives bomb threat emails, third incident this week

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: The Hindu

A Delhi school received a bomb threat on Saturday (December 14, 2024), marking the third instance of threat emails being sent to schools in the national capital this week.

  • The bomb threat was reported at DPS RK Puram at 6:09 am.
  • Authorities from the fire department, local police, and bomb detection teams conducted a thorough search of the school.
  • No suspicious items were found during the searches conducted following the bomb threat.
  • On the previous day, around 30 schools received similar bomb threat emails, prompting multi-agency search operations.
  • A total of 44 schools had received bomb threats via email earlier in the week, which were later classified as hoaxes.
"We received a call about a bomb threat at DPS RK Puram at 6:09 am," a Delhi Fire Services official said.

The pattern of bomb threats raises concerns about safety in schools, though previous threats were deemed hoaxes. Ongoing investigations continue to monitor the situation closely.

item.title: Another Low-Pressure Area Over Bay Of Bengal To Impact Chennai; Cold Wave Grips North India - News18
item.description:
Another Low-Pressure Area Over Bay Of Bengal To Impact Chennai; Cold Wave Grips North India

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: News18

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has warned that another low-pressure area over the Bay of Bengal will bring rainfall to Chennai and its suburbs next week, while parts of North India are experiencing a severe cold wave.

  • IMD anticipates rainfall for Chennai and its surrounding areas by mid-next week due to a new low-pressure system.
  • A yellow alert for rain is in place for Saturday, with heavy rainfall expected in 12 districts, including Chengalpet and Kancheepuram, on December 17 and 18.
  • Light to moderate rainfall is forecasted for Chennai on December 14, with heavier rain likely from December 16 to 18.
  • North India is under a cold wave alert, particularly in Punjab and parts of West Bengal, with temperatures expected to drop to 2-6 degrees Celsius.
  • Severe cold is being reported in Rajasthan, with some areas experiencing sub-zero temperatures.
"In the past few weeks, Chennai witnessed incessant rainfall, causing waterlogging and paralysing normal life."

The prevailing weather conditions signal a significant shift as Chennai prepares for more rain, while northern regions face the brunt of a cold wave, highlighting the diverse climatic challenges across India.

item.title: LIVE | Kerala Lottery Results 14.12.2024: Karunya KR-684 Winners Soon; First Prize Rs 80 Lakh! - News18
item.description:
LIVE | Kerala Lottery Results 14.12.2024: Karunya KR-684 Winners Soon; First Prize Rs 80 Lakh!

Date: December 14, 2024

Source: News18

The Kerala State Lottery Department is set to announce the results of the Karunya KR-684 lottery on December 14, with a first prize of Rs 80 lakh and additional substantial prizes.

  • The lottery draw will take place at 3 PM IST.
  • First Prize: Rs 80 lakh
  • Second Prize: Rs 5 lakh
  • Third Prize: Rs 1 lakh
  • The full list of winning numbers will be available after the draw.
“To claim a prize, your ticket number must exactly match the official winning numbers.”

Winners have 30 days from the draw date to claim their prizes, and they must provide necessary documentation when visiting the Kerala Lottery headquarters.
